title: LIMIT clause
text: The LIMIT clause specifies the number of records that the query returns.

title: OFFSET clause
text: The number specified in the OFFSET clause specifies the number of records that are skipped at the beginning.

title: Inclusive OFFSET clause
text: The OFFSET clause skips the values, inclusive of the last record that is specified in the query.

hintAnswer: It specifies the number of rows to skip before starting to return rows.
title: Understanding OFFSET in SQL
text: What does the OFFSET keyword in a SQL query do?
choices: It limits the number of rows returned.
It specifies the number of rows to skip before starting to return rows.
It filters rows based on conditions.

hintAnswer: It limits the results to the first $$10$$ rows after the OFFSET is applied.
title: Interpreting the LIMIT Clause
text: What does LIMIT $$10$$ do in a SQL query?
choices: It limits the results to a maximum of $$10$$ rows.
It filters results to rows matching specific conditions.
It limits the results to the first $$10$$ rows after the OFFSET is applied.

hintAnswer: It returns $$10$$ records starting from the 6th record.
title: Combining LIMIT and OFFSET
text: Consider a SQL query ending with LIMIT $$10$$ OFFSET $$5$$. How does it affect the data returned?
choices: It returns $$10$$ records starting from the 5th record.
It returns $$10$$ records starting from the 6th record.

title: Final Answer
text: Summary: A LIMIT of $$10$$ with an OFFSET of $$5$$ means the first five records are skipped, and then $$10$$ records are selected.
